I make gifs, reviews of media, and goofy captions on screenshots. Now I also do video editing and webdev & design at reasonable prices!

if you're reading this and you searched for one of the tags below the first five lemme know!
title: End of 2018 Anime recs
body:
I watched a lot of anime this year. I mean a LOT of anime to the point where I had to cut a lot of them out to watch later. It has easily been the best year for anime I’ve ever seen, though there were a few notable stinkers. Out of the ones i’ve watched, or given the 3-episode test to, I’ve liked 100% of them, so if you respect my taste in anime at all, here’s what I would recommend you watch, having consumed all of these at least in some part. In no particular order, I give you the list below the cut.

Hinamatsuri (Full watch) - I went in looking for a comedy, I came out completely in love with this show’s character design and story. It remains really funny, but has a heart in a way I didn’t expect.

Devilman Crybaby (3-episode test) - I already knew the plot and where this one was going from the manga so I just gave this one the 3 episode test and, yeah, it’s really good. Grim and dark and gruesome and I love it. Will be finishing this one out eventually just to see the wonderful animation work that has been put into it.

Wotakoi/Love is difficult for otaku (3-episode test) - I don’t usually go in on romance anime, and I think this one is from a light novel, and I avoid those even harder as a rule, but this one’s concept sounded pretty good. I’d like to see where this one goes, or if it completely ends up predictably.

Aggretsuko (Full watch) - I watched this in the original subtitles before it came to Netflix (or maybe they were pirate subtitles? I don’t remember) but this is the year it became popular. It’s weird that this goofy red panda that loves heavy metal is the most relatable character to me out of almost any anime protagonist of recent memory. Along with Wotakoi, this has one of the rare ‘adult romance’ stories, as well as being funny as hell.

Jojo’s Bizzare Adventure part 5 (Ongoing) - I will continue to reccommend every part of Jojos because even if this part isn’t for you, there might be another part coming up that is more your cup of tea. Not to mention, David Productions knocks it out of the park with adapting Araki’s artstyle in a way I never would’ve thought possible before Part 1 began. The anime-original additional scenes also add a lot to the story, and I can’t wait to see where this one goes next.

Skull-faced Bookseller Honda/Gaikotsu Shotenin Honda-san (Partial completion) - I’m going to go and finish watching the remaining few episodes of this after I complete this list. To anyone who’s ever worked in Retail, the struggles of Honda-san are way, way too real. Not to mention, you know that all of this really happened to a real person as it’s autobiographical.

Cells at work/Hataraku Saibou (Full watch) - I mean…I could say ‘just refer to my Cells At Work saved my life’ post if you want a rec on this one. It’s amazing, educational, good gore, great character design, and personally significant to me, what more could I possibly say than that?

Goblin Slayer (Full watch) - I have lots of thoughts on this one that I will elaborate on in a later review post, but I also kind of want to hold off until season 2 happens. I’m not sure. If you can get past the first episode, which is admittedly kind of rough to watch (I’m getting a little queasy thinking about it) there’s some excellent gore, an interesting story and theming, and it will go places you don’t expect, no matter WHAT you expect. Dismemberment/maiming and rape scenes are in this, so make sure you can handle that before you go in.

Golden Kamuy Season 2 (Full watch) - I can reccommend this one to you if you like Westerns, Period Drama, Comedy…gay porn, I dunno, it’s got something for just about everybody. Character design is off the charts, the story continually breaks and repairs my heart, comedic beats never ‘miss’ for me. I have never read the manga but I’m sorely tempted to see where the story goes next before season 3 drops.

Yuru Camp/Laid Back Camp (3-episode test) - Okay, seriously though, I hate moe`. I think it’s a trash genre meant to sell to the lowest common denominator. And I fucking LOVED Yuru camp. It plays out almost like an educational anime, with a voice-over that comes in to explain camping and bushcraft techniques. I’d say the cute girls are incidental, but they’re characters in their own right, and they read as actual friends. Not lesbian-bait ‘friends’ either. It’s hard to say who it’s for, other than me, who likes camping, but maybe otaku who are interested in camping? People who love cute girls in pastoral scenes? Something like that.

Boku no Hero Academia/My Hero Academy season 3 (Full watch) - I’ve been calling this ‘Naruto without all the stuff that makes me hate Naruto’ or ‘Western comics done better’ or ‘Western comics from a Japanese creator’s experience’ and i’m not sure which one is more accurate yet. Everyone already knows this one, knows how good it is, storywise, character design wise, and animationwise, as Studio Bones always seems to know exactly where to put the money and where to save on it. This is one that’s probably actively better than the manga because the voice acting and animation lends new emotion to the characters beyond what could possibly be on the page. Still if you are trying to avoid or ignore one of the biggest shonen series of recent years, I hope my first three statements will convince you to try it.

A Place Further Than The Universe (3-Episode test) - I wasn’t sure what to expect from this one, because of the zany-sounding premise. A trip to antarctica? How bizzare! But i’m actually eager to see where things go, as this seems awfully grounded and ‘normal’ so far.

Honorable Mentions: Aka the ‘I didn’t watch it but I kind of regret it’ category.

Megalo Box: I ignored this one initially because it sounded like it was completely disrespecting the sport of boxing, but then had the plot synopsis told to me and now i’m regretting that decision, and I want to go back to it.

Zombieland Saga: I categorically ignore any idol anime, especially when it seems to have a really stupid gimmick to it, but then the whole Lily thing appeared and I kinda have to see it now, I guess.

So that’s it for 2018! Maybe the best year for anime ever, but now we have 2019 to look forward to, and I hope my expectations are broken so by next year I wonder how I thought 2018 was the best!

blog.description: Stop motion animator | 17 | He/Him | Mashup artist | Eddsworld, Mystery Skulls, Jojo's Bizarre Adventure, & Aggretsuko fan | Huge Dj Earworm fan | Fan of other things too | Furry | Follow my Twitter (@Legolordfilms) and subscribe to my YouTube (Legolordfilms)

summary: I wanted to say this yesterday but I didn't have the time to!
body:
I wanted to say this yesterday but I didn’t have the time to!

2018 was a pretty big year for me! I reached 1 million views on my YT channel, I hit 2k on my YT channel, made a lot of online friends (discord friends specifically), got into my now most favorite show of all-time (Aggrestuko), gotten even more better w/ mashups, gotten more involved with the furry fandom, and had the BEST new year’s of my life! So yeah, it was pretty crazy! Here’s to a great 2019!

I wanted to say this yesterday but I didn’t have the time to!

2018 was a pretty big year for me! I reached 1 million views on my YT channel, I hit 2k on my YT channel, made a lot of online friends (discord friends specifically), got into my now most favorite show of all-time (Aggrestuko), gotten even more better w/ mashups, gotten more involved with the furry fandom, and had the BEST new year’s of my life! So yeah, it was pretty crazy! Here’s to a great 2019!

tags: we wish you a metal christmas
summary: we wish you a metal christmas
title: we wish you a metal christmas
body:
So, yeah, I just watched the Retsuko, Christmas special. 

*big sigh*

WTH? (Spoilers below so don’t click if you haven’t seen Season1 OR the Special)

So, end of season 1 left us with a cliff hanger, and the special was like WTH?  Because it’s implied that Retsuko and Haida are an item.  When, at the Christmas special she TURNS HIM DOWN!!!

OK

WTF Netflix? What. The. Fuck?  The Anime, with english sub implies they are together, the english dub basically implies they are together. She is finally happy because she’s got 1) a cool guy 2) her job is coming together 3) she’s getting more confident and self-assured in navigating the shitty world called “adulthood”

Then you go an do this shit?

The Fuck?

I’m not sure what angle you all are going with this, but I almost don’t even want to count this special as canon because Retsuko is so OOC.  I mean WTF, why the fuck is she hanging with bambi and so caught up in Social Media popularity? The thing with Retsuko that made her so fucking relatable was that she DIDN’T fall for the hype of social media.  In fact, she was too fucking cool for it, but this special turned her into a flaky shadow of her former metal self.

Even the time she goes metal in Season 1, it was a natural reaction to people being shitty and her just taking so much.  Yet in this, everyone is pretty nice.  They are their usual self, but for the most part, even her boss who is a douche for dumping work on her, is still acting in character.  What is jarring is how OUT OF CHARACTER Retsuko is behaving.

I hope I’m not the only one who noticed this, and who feels like this special was a big let down.  I hope Season 2 is better, but I feel really apprehensive about it now.

blog.description:
Yo soy un hombre con varios talentos para el arte tradicional y digital, tambien me gustaria algun dia trabajar en peliculas animadas, hacer comics, series animadas de TV, algun videojuego y cosas asi. 
Actualmente estoy estudiando en la universidad UNIACC.
Si me siguen verán un montón de arte de muy buena calidad tanto digital como tradicional, sketches, fanart y incluso algunos modelos 3D.
Tambien tengo otro blog doncuchufly.tumblr.com donde posteo chistes de mi personaje El Don Cuchufly.
Tambien tengo otra pagina en Sav8197.deviantart.com donde tambien subo todo tipo de arte.

summary: This is a Aggretsuko fanart i did sometime ago last year and now i have decided to color the lineart and finish it, but not in...
caption:
This is a Aggretsuko fanart i did sometime ago last year and now i have decided to color the lineart and finish it, but not in the way i usually do, i really wanted to make it look exactly or at least as similar as possible to the same type of lighting and shading that the anime itself uses.

The background was hard to figure out how to get it right, but once i figure it out it wasnt so hard to do. What really gave me some trouble was all those glowing effects! XD especially since i usually dont do that type of stuff on my digital art at all, like the red glowing effect behind her, the lighting bolt effect and especially her glowing eyes, all of those were really hard to do but i think i managed to make it look as close to the original as possible.

I think this was a really good drawing to start this new year 2019, oh and speaking about that Happy New year!  

Aggretsuko belongs to Sanrio and Fanworks.

summary: As someone who liked the original Aggretsuko, I felt like the Christmas special was pretty subpar mainly because of the poorly...
body: As someone who liked the original Aggretsuko, I felt like the Christmas special was pretty subpar mainly because of the poorly executed themes of “ooga booga technology bad”, “we live in a society, bottom text”, and the fact that basically all the plot threads could have easily been resolved in another arc, making it feel wholly unnecessary.

reblog.comment: As someone who liked the original Aggretsuko, I felt like the Christmas special was pretty subpar mainly because of the poorly executed themes of “ooga booga technology bad”, “we live in a society, bottom text”, and the fact that basically all the plot threads could have easily been resolved in another arc, making it feel wholly unnecessary.

trail.content_raw: As someone who liked the original Aggretsuko, I felt like the Christmas special was pretty subpar mainly because of the poorly executed themes of “ooga booga technology bad”, “we live in a society, bottom text”, and the fact that basically all the plot threads could have easily been resolved in another arc, making it feel wholly unnecessary.
trail.content: As someone who liked the original Aggretsuko, I felt like the Christmas special was pretty subpar mainly because of the poorly executed themes of “ooga booga technology bad”, “we live in a society, bottom text”, and the fact that basically all the plot threads could have easily been resolved in another arc, making it feel wholly unnecessary.

blog.name: sanjapan
blog.title: San Japan Official Tumblr
blog.description:
San Japan is a Japanese Anime-Focused convention based in San Antonio, Texas. It is a 3-day convention event. It is the largest fan-run anime convention in San Antonio. 
San Japan is located at the heart of the historic and popular River Walk taking place at the Henry B. Gonzalez Convention Center.
The 2019 convention dates are August 30th - September 1st, 2019 taking place on Labor Day Weekend 2019.
If you have a question to send in then please click here. Be sure to read the FAQ in place as we linked to most of the common questions that we've received over the years.

summary:
Please welcome our guest of honor for Mini-Mini Con 2019, Erica Mendez.

 Chicago native Erica Mendez is longtime animation and...
caption:
Please welcome our guest of honor for Mini-Mini Con 2019, Erica Mendez.

Chicago native Erica Mendez is longtime animation and video game fan who is now working as a voice actress in Los Angeles. She’s been fortunate to play some fan-favorite characters, including: Retsuko in Aggretsuko, Ryuko in KILL la KILL, Gon in Hunter x Hunter, Aladdin in Magi: The Labyrinth of Magic, Yuuki in Sword Art Online II, Sailor Uranus in the new Viz Media dub of Sailor Moon, Akko in Little Witch Academia, Diane in Seven Deadly Sins, Nico in Love Live, and Mash in Fate/Grand Order.

There will be a limit of two free autographs per attendee. Any additional autographs will be charged a price set by the guest (amount to be decided at the convention which will be cash only). Attendees may bring their own items to be autographed.

See her May 4th in San Antonio at Mini-Mini Con 2019.
